item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: Including Me
item.description: This video shows how a little girl's prayers that her family would be sealed in the temple were answered.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Stand Up Boldly
item.description: Statement by Adrián Ochoa in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Enemy Territory
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they "heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost."

item.title: The Golden Rule
item.description: (3 Nephi 14:12) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the golden rule encompasses the moral code.

item.title: Being One with God and Christ
item.description: (John 17:11, 20–23) By submitting to the Father, Jesus Christ achieved perfect unity. An excerpt from “That They May Be One in Us,” Ensign, Nov. 2002.

item.title: See Others as They May Become
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Priesthood session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: Gather in Stakes
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to gather in stakes (D&C 101:20-22,63-75).

item.title: We Come Together & Unite As One
item.description: As much as our differences enrich our collective experience, the Gospel of Jesus Christ transcends them all.

item.title: Jesus Declares He Is the Messiah
item.description: Jesus announces that He is the Messiah prophesied by Isaiah, but is rejected by His neighbors in Nazareth. Luke 4:15-30

item.title: Jesus Declares, "I Am the Light of the World, the Truth Shall Make You Free"
item.description: Jesus declares that He is the light of the world, and the Son of God. Whosoever will embrace His gospel and follow Him can be freed from sin. John 8:12-58

item.title: Things of the World
item.description: (Genesis 13:1-13) Elder Scott teaches to eliminate distractions from our lives.

item.title: Worldly Pleasures
item.description: (Ecclesiastes 1-2) Elder Perry encourages church members to seek of the things of the spirit and not those of the world.

item.title: The Heart and a Willing Mind
item.description: (D&C 64:34) Elder Heber C. Kimball and his family willingly serve the Lord as Elder Kimball leaves first from Kirtland and then from Nauvoo to preach the gospel in England.

item.title: Joseph Smith: The Prophet of the Restoration (DVD Release)
item.description: A motion picture about the life and legacy of Joseph Smith, the founding prophet of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: God’s Laws Bless His Children
item.description: (3 Nephi 15:1–10) Elder L. Tom Perry testifies that God’s laws govern and bless His children. (“We Believe All That God Has Revealed,” Ensign, Nov. 2003, 85–88.)

item.title: Price Of Discipleship
item.description: (Luke 14:25-33) President James E. Faust speaks about the price of discipleship.

item.title: Qualifications for Bishops
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley lists the qualities and attributes of successful bishops.

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 1
item.description: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: 4.2 When Teachers and Students Join in Prayer and Faith
item.description: President Eyring shares an experience he had while teaching a class that illustrates the powerful spiritual experiences teachers and students can have in class when they are all prepared (Henry B. Eyring, "To Know and to Love God," Feb. 26, 2010).

item.title: Quorum Brotherhood
item.description: A quorum rallies around a young man who attended scouting activities for years. With their help, he comes to a knowledge of the truthfulness of the restored gospel, and is ordained to the Aaronic priesthood.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Caring for the Poor and Needy
item.description: A brief overview of how The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints cares for and teaches self-reliance to the poor and needy through its Welfare program and fast offering donations.

item.title: They Gave Up Their Christmas
item.description: Just as the wise men of old gave the Christ child gifts, members of a congregation in California offer service in a vineyard on Christmas day.

item.title: Healing the Sick
item.description: (Mark 6:5, 13; 7:32) Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks of the principle of anointings for Priesthood blessings. An excerpt from “Healing the Sick,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2010.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Woman of Faith
item.description: Jesus heals a woman's illness when she, in faith, touches His clothing. Mark 5:22-43

item.title: We Can Live With God Again
item.description: Our lives will not end when we die. Our future lives are determined by the way we live our lives now.

item.title: If We Are Well Prepared, Death Brings No Terror
item.description: (Alma 28:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches what soothes the sting and sadness caused by the death of a loved one.

item.title: Blessings of Following Prophets
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry teaches obedience to the prophet yields blessings (Jeremiah 27-28).

item.title: The Second Coming Segment 2
item.description: Three general conference excerpts address modern-day issues concerning the Second Coming of the Savior. Segment 2 - Elder Boyd K. Packer. 2 Thessalonians 1:1-2:3

item.title: We Act
item.description: If the youth are going to become converted, they can't just listen. They have to act on what they're learning.

item.title: Come with Us
item.description: Youth from around the world share what this year's theme means to them and what they are doing to “Come unto Christ.”

item.title: Prepare Today for the Second Coming
item.description: (Joseph Smith—Matthew 1:46–54; Matthew 24:42–51) An excerpt from “Preparation for the Second Coming,” Ensign or Liahona, May 2004, 8–9.

item.title: Jesus was God The Creator
item.description: (John 1:1-3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks of the beautiful creations of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Jesus Christ Will Be Our Final Judge
item.description: (John 5:22, 27, 30) Elder Scott declares that the Atonement makes it possible for Jesus Christ to be our final judge. An excerpt from “The Atonement Can Secure Your Peace and Happiness,” Ensign and Liahona, Nov. 2006.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: Preparing for the Second Coming
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches the importance of preparing for the Second Coming (D&C 45:24-59).

item.title: Standing in Holy Places
item.description: A young woman reflects on the blessings of walking the covenant path as she makes her journey to the temple.

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the ten virgins. Matthew 25:1-13

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: King James Version Quotes
item.description: General authorities comment on the KJV of the bible.

item.title: Zion: A Destination and a Process
item.description: Elder Hales teaches how Zion is both a destination and a process (D&C 45:64-71).

item.title: Gathering to Lands of Promise
item.description: (2 Nephi 9:1-3) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about gathering to lands of promise.

item.title: If We Teach by the Spirit
item.description: By teaching and listening by the spirit, all are edified and strengthened, individually and collectively.

item.title: Conversion Story—Linda
item.description: Linda shares how the example of her member friends led her to attend church for the first time.

item.title: The Holy Ghost Helps Us Avoid Deception
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches how the Holy Ghost helps us avoid deception (D&C 46:1-8).

item.title: Extraordinary Gift
item.description: Kuha'o, a blind 15-year-old piano prodigy, freely shares his God given musical gift to bless the lives of everyone who listens.

item.title: No Cussing Club
item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.title: Turning Hearts
item.description: A Great-Grandfather's journal helps a young man gain direction in his life and appreciation for his ancestors.

item.title: Ordinances and Covenants - The Spirit of Elijah
item.description: A young woman and her family discover the unanticipated blessings of family history work.

item.title: What is Truth? Highlight 3
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf encourages young adults and expresses the Lord's confidence in them.

item.title: Selective Obedience
item.description: Elder Pace counsels against selective obedience (D&C 49:1-14).

item.title: Peter Preaches and is Arrested
item.description: Peter and John are arrested for preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ in Jerusalem. Acts 3:12-26, 4:1-3

item.title: Man And Woman
item.description: (1 Corinthians 11:11) President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies that man and woman are God's design.

item.title: Deseret Dairy
item.description: A team manager at the Elberta dairy explains the process of producing dairy products. He emphasizes the blessing the products are to families in need and expresses the testimony he has gained by helping others.

item.title: Satan Seeks to Deceive Us
item.description: Elder Oaks admonishes how Satan seeks to deceive us (D&C 50:1-9).

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:23–28) An excerpt from “What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?” Ensign or Liahona, May 2011.

item.title: A Man without Eloquence
item.description: (D&C 50:17-22) The testimony of a humble teacher helps Brigham Young become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: Faith Lights the Way
item.description: President Hinckley teaches how faith lights the way (D&C 50:23-24).

item.title: Patterns of Light: Discerning Light
item.description: How do we recognize divine light and discern it from our own thoughts? In part 2 of this three part series, Elder David A. Bednar discusses how to discern and act upon light from God. View Part 1, Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.title: Honesty: You Better Believe It!
item.description: It is better to be honest than get a good score on a test.

item.title: Daily Bread: Experience
item.description: Sometimes in life, there is no where else to turn but to God. Elder D. Todd Christofferson shares a personal experience that taught him to truly pray, recognize answers to prayers, and take life one day at a time.

item.title: Michelle's Story
item.description: Local Church leaders and members strive to help the poor and needy and follow the admonition of James to "visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction" (James 1:27).

item.title: Commit to Righteousness
item.description: Elder Donald L. Hallstrom explains that to be true disciples we must receive and obey the Lord’s law.

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Conversion of W. W. Phelps
item.description: This video portrays the events that led to the conversion of W. W. Phelps (D&C 55).

item.title: Need for Greatest Generation of Missionaries
item.description: (Jeremiah 16:14-16) Elder Ballard speaks on the standard of missionary service, and encourages young men to live worthily to serve missions.

item.title: The Savior Wants to Forgive
item.description: A former addict and repeat convict shares his experiences with the Savior’s ability and willingness to forgive him again and again, even when he felt undeserving.

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealand's national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.
